verses.kjv: Brethren, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, my deepest wish and my prayer to God for Israel is that they would be saved.

verses.kjv: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.
verses.ct: I can testify that they are passionate about God, but their passion isn't guided by true understanding.

verses.kjv: For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.
verses.ct: Since they didn't recognize God's righteousness, they tried to set up their own version of righteousness and refused to accept God's righteousness.

verses.kjv: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.
verses.ct: Because Christ is the fulfillment of the law, bringing righteousness to everyone who believes.

verses.kjv: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law, That the man which doeth those things shall live by them.
verses.ct: Moses wrote about the righteousness that comes through the law: "The person who does these things will find life through them."

verses.kjv: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)
verses.ct: But the righteousness that comes through faith says something different: "Don't ask yourself, 'Who will go up into heaven?'" — meaning, to bring Christ down —

verses.kjv: Or, Who shall descend into the deep? (that is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.)
verses.ct: "or 'Who will go down into the depths below?'" — meaning, to bring Christ back from the dead.

verses.kjv: But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;
verses.ct: Instead, what does it say? "The message is near you, right on your lips and in your heart." This is the message of faith that we proclaim.

verses.kjv: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.
verses.ct: If you declare with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

verses.kjv: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
verses.ct: A person believes with the heart and receives righteousness, and declares with the mouth and receives salvation.

verses.kjv: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.
verses.ct: Scripture says, "Whoever believes in him will never be put to shame."

verses.kjv: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.
verses.ct: There is no distinction between Jew and Greek, because the same Lord is Lord of all and generously blesses everyone who calls on him.

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
verses.ct: Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.

verses.kjv: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?
verses.ct: But how can people call on someone they haven't believed in? How can they believe in someone they haven't heard about? And how can they hear unless someone tells them?

verses.kjv: And how shall they preach, except they be sent? as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!
verses.ct: And how can anyone tell them unless they are sent? As Scripture says, "How welcome are the feet of those who bring good news of peace and announce wonderful things!"

verses.kjv: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Esaias saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?
verses.ct: But not everyone accepted the good news. Isaiah asked, "Lord, who has believed our message?"

verses.kjv: So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
verses.ct: So faith comes from hearing the message, and the message comes through the word of God.

verses.kjv: But I say, Have they not heard? Yes verily, their sound went into all the earth, and their words unto the ends of the world.
verses.ct: But let me ask — haven't they heard it? Of course they have! "Their voice has gone out across the whole earth, and their words have reached the ends of the world."

verses.kjv: But I say, Did not Israel know? First Moses saith, I will provoke you to jealousy by them that are no people, and by a foolish nation I will anger you.
verses.ct: Let me ask another question — didn't Israel understand? First, Moses says, "I will make you jealous through a nation that isn't really a nation; I will make you angry through a foolish nation."

verses.kjv: But Esaias is very bold, and saith, I was found of them that sought me not; I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me.
verses.ct: Then Isaiah speaks even more boldly: "I was discovered by people who weren't even looking for me; I revealed myself to those who never asked about me."

verses.kjv: But to Israel he saith, All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.
verses.ct: But regarding Israel, he says, "All day long I have held out my hands to a disobedient and defiant people."
